text: yes graham i suffer from this problam too
The chances that this theme has everything that my CLEAN Pro theme does are very slim.  Did someone tell you it had all the same features of CLEAN or where did you hear that?

Is anyone aware of how to specify a specific attribute within the SPACING style field?

For example: I'm trying to specific the padding-top.

I would assume I could write the variable like this `{{ <http://module.style.hero_spacing.padding.top|module.style.hero_spacing.padding.top> }}` however that throws an error.

What am I missing?

Have you tried using the variable with `.css`?

Example:
`{{ module.style.hero_spacing.css }}`
Did you figure this out? The easiest way to get the code right is to just build this in a page editor --> enter dev mode `?developerMode=true`--> hover over the section and click copy hubl.
I figured it out, but this is life-saving, thank you!
@Oscar Thipphakhinkeo Yep, but that generates all the CSS properties. I need to `print` the value of one of the properties.
Ahh, my mistake misunderstood the question
No worries. I appreciate the try
